contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox album | <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Albums --> Name = Victor | Type = [[Album]] | Artist = [[Alex Lifeson]] (as Victor) | Cover = Alex Lifeson Victor AC.jpg | Released = January 9, 1996 | Recorded = Oct 1994-July 1995| Genre = [[Rock and roll|Rock]] | Length = 50:24 | Label = [[Atlantic Records|Atlantic]] (Outside Canada) / [[Anthem Records]] (Within Canada) | Producer = [[Alex Lifeson]] | Last album = | This album = ''Victor'' <br /> (2000) | Next album = |}} <!-- END WikiProject Album infobox --> {{Album ratings | rev1 = [[Allmusic]] | rev1Score = {{Rating|2|5}} <ref>{{Allmusic|class=album|id=r233222|first=Bret|last=Adams}}</ref> | rev2 = | rev2Score = | noprose = yes }} '''''Victor''''' is a solo [[album]] by [[Rush (band)|Rush]] guitarist [[Alex Lifeson]] under the name "Victor" released January 9, 1996 on [[Atlantic Records]] outside of Canada and [[Anthem Records]] within Canada. The album was recorded at Lerxst Sound (Lifeson's home studio) between October 1994 and July 1995. The album reached #99 on the [[Billboard 200]] in 1996 and received a 1997 [[Juno Award]] nomination for Best New Group. ==Track listing== # "Don’t Care" ([[Alex Lifeson]]) – 4:04 # "Promise" (Lifeson, Bill Bell) – 5:44 # "Start Today" (Lifeson) – 3:48 # "Mr. X" (Lifeson) – 2:21 # "At the End" (Lifeson, [[Adrian Zivojinovich]]) – 6:07 # "Sending Out a Warning" (Lifeson, Bell) – 4:11 # "Shut Up Shuttin’ Up" (Lifeson, Bell, Charlene, Esther) – 4:02 # "Strip and Go Naked" (Lifeson, Bell) – 3:57 # "The Big Dance" (Lifeson, Zivojinovich) – 4:14 # "Victor" (Lifeson, [[W. H. Auden]]) – 6:25 # "I Am the Spirit" (Lifeson, Bell)– 5:31 "Victor" is based on the poem by W. H. Auden. ==Personnel== * [[Alex Lifeson]] - vocals, guitars, keyboards, bass, programming * [[Les Claypool]] - bass on track 9 * [[Peter Cardinali]] - bass * [[Bill Bell (musician)|Bill Bell]] - guitar * [[Dalbello]] - Lead vocal on track 3 * [[Edwin (musician)|Edwin]] - Lead vocals * [[Blake Manning]] - drums * [[Colleen Allen]] - horn * [[Adrian Zivojinovich]] - programming Lifeson's wife Charlene is one of the two women in the track 7 dialogue; the other woman is simply listed as "Esther". ==Singles== {| class="wikitable" !align="left"|Information |- |align="left"|'''"Don't Care"''' *Released: 1995 *Written by: Alex Lifeson *Produced by: [[Alex Lifeson]] *Chart positions: |- |align="left"|'''"[[I Am the Spirit]]"''' *Released: *Written by: Alex Lifeson and Bill Bell *Produced by: [[Alex Lifeson]] *Chart positions: |- |align="left"|'''"[[Promise (Alex Lifeson song)|Promise]]"''' *Released: December 4, 1995 *Written by: Alex Lifeson and Bill Bell *Produced by: [[Alex Lifeson]] *Chart positions: |} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *http://books.google.com.ec/books?id=NA0EAAAAMBAJ&pg=PA18&dq=alex+lifeson+victor&hl=es&ei=98tPTO_7G4H-8Aa-meCOAQ&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=1&ved=0CCoQ6AEwAA#v=onepage&q=alex%20lifeson%20victor&f=false *http://www.2112.net/powerwindows/main/VIClyrics.htm *http://metal-archives.com/ {{Rush}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Victor (Album)}} [[Category:Alex Lifeson albums]] [[Category:1996 albums]] [[Category:Anthem Records albums]]
